Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Criminally \Crim"i*nal*ly\ (kr?m"?-nal-l?), adv. In violation of law; wickedly. [1913 Webster]

criminally adv 1: in a shameful manner; "the garden was criminally neglected" [syn: {reprehensively}] 2: in violation of the law; in a criminal manner; "the alterations in the document were ruled to be criminally fraudulent"
